Blog.post: FRIENDS NOW AND FOREVER CINDY’S FIRST BOYFRIEND “ Oh!! My God I am so excited today’s Alisha’s birthday? I can’t believe she’s inviting boys. I hate boys and….” was all that I kept saying as the evening kept coming closer and closer. Today is Alisha’s 11 th birthday and I am beginning to feel very anxious. But the worst thing is she’s inviting boys. Yuck!! I am Cindy Smith and I am 11 years. Alisha Graham is not my best friend but we pretty much hang around together. We live in Canley heights, Australia . It’s a really cool place and we go to Canley Heights Public School . Kylie Rodriguez is my best friend and we love hanging around, shopping and of course we do a bit of studying together. I do have other friends like Petronella curk and Amelia Billick and I can tell you that even though we are 11 and supposed to be acting like “young ladies” as our parents say, we are tom boys(except one of us) and we enjoy being just the way we are. Alisha however doesn’t behave like us any more. Its fun being around her but suddenly she acts weird. I’ve spoken to my mum about it but she tells me that Alisha is going through a phase and that she’s growing up. She plays around with us but all of a sudden when Julian, Ian and Harry come around she acts peculiar. Last year she could stand up to them when they bullied us around and now she finds them good-looking. Yuck!! Today Alisha is having her birthday party and she asked me to help her put up her decorations. So I said I’ll do it. I have to arrive an hour earlier so that means I have to start going in for my shower. I already chose my clothes a pair of jeans and a red top that said GIRLS RULE! Alisha helped me pick out that top; she said it matched perfectly with my brown complexion. I have brown skin and jet black hair, tall and chubby. I have no brothers or sisters and sometimes it gets lonely. Petronella and Kylie have somewhat the same features except that they’re a bit thinner. Petronella hasn’t got a brother and a dad. Kylie has a sister who’s two years younger than her. Alisha wants to become a model when she’s older so she’s cut out all the chocolates and fatty stuff from her diet. She’s really skinny and tall but I must admit that she is prettier than the rest of us. Amelia is quiet but that doesn’t mean I bully her around, she voices her opinion whenever she wants to. Kylie and Petronella are just like me we’re bold and stand up for ourselves. But Amelia is good looking too. The five of us have been friends since kindergarten and FRIENDS NOW AND FOREVER is the motto of our little group. To tell you the truth I came up with it (I’m not boasting). Alisha used to be like us but she’s changing, and changing rapidly. I got ready to go and my mum said she’d drive me over. It was a ten minute drive but I heard a ten-minute lecture as well, with things like “Cindy, behave like a young girl, act decently and give us a call when the party’s over so that I can pick you up.” “Alright mum, I know, I know”. Mum can be annoying sometimes that she makes me want to scream. I arrived at Alisha’s place and I rang the door bell. It was about two seconds later till I heard Stephanie’s voice saying “I’ll get it, you carry on” “hello steff what’s up?” nothing much how bout you?” “Nothing” “Alisha’s in her room, I’ve gotta run, cya later?” “Cya” Stephanie is Alisha’s older sister. She’s 14 and when she went out with a boy for the first time, all of us whispered to each other with words like “gross”, “yuck”, and “is she crazy” And Alisha said the same thing but now it seems like she’s desperate to get a boyfriend. Alisha also has an older brother and he’s 17. His name is Nathan but I don’t speak to him that much because he seems to be leading a very busy life. Alisha’s sister and brother go to high school. I went up to Alisha’s room which took me about 2mins as her house is quite big comparing to any of us. I knocked on her bedroom door which said “ALISHA’S ROOM” and below it said “PLEASE KNOCK BEFORE ENTERING”. Immediately a voice replied “who is it” and I answered back saying “it’s me Cindy can I come in?” “Yeah sure”. So I went in and I stood there dumbstruck with my mouth opened. I couldn’t say anything, but at last when I could speak I said “What on earth has got into you?” “Hello Cindy, do you like my new hairdo?”Alisha had on a lovely blue dress with a red motive. But that wasn’t the point, she had make-up on (a bit too much) and her lovely brown hair was now blonde. I always loved her hair but look what’s she’s done to it. “What did you do to yourself?” I asked. “Oh! Cindy you won’t understand, steff helped me do it and I love it” “I don’t know what’s wrong with you but if you’re comfy with it then that’s good”. Deep down inside I wished that she would come back and be normal like us. I plonked myself on the bed and looked around and to my horror found that her bedroom was re-arranged. I was so busy looking at the birthday girl that I hadn’t noticed her room. All the posters of Barbie and Winne the pooh had been pulled down and new posters of some freaky guys were up. I didn’t like it at all. “Happy birthday to me” she started singing and it was only then that I realised that I’d forgotten to wish her for her birthday. “Alisha, I’m sorry I forgot”. Handing her a parcel wrapped up in gift wrapping paper I apologetically said “happy 11 th birthday”. “That’s alright, I was just kidding” she said as she received it. She came over and I gave her a hug.” Really” I asked “And to get your present” With that we cracked up with laughter and later she said” The decorations are done but I was hoping that maybe, you could help me take the food down to the rumpus room?” “ Happy to help” I answered and with that we went down and laid out the table with all kinds of sandwiches, chips, punch, biscuits, and some fruit for the birthday girl. When that was done, she checked her c.d player and all her cd’s. “Alisha, are you going to have dancing?” I asked hoping she’d say no. “Of course Cindy, everyone from our class are going to be there and everyone loves dancing so I decided I’ll have dancing after all”. I didn’t know how to dance but I curiously asked again “Is it going to be like a boy-girl dancing party”? “Maybe, but I hope Ian is there, I want to dance with him” she said as if she was in the seventh heaven. I just carried on and I couldn’t wait for Petronella, Kylie and Amelia to arrive. One, by one everyone started coming in and then Kylie came in. I was so happy to see her. She was also dressed in her normal, casual clothes. Amelia and petronella also arrived soon and the party began. Alisha went over and started to chat with Ian as if he was a movie star or something. I couldn’t wait for the games to begin. I’ve always loved that part of the party the best since I was small. Alisha played some music and said “everyone lets dance”. It was a slow number and it had to be a waltz. Everyone somehow found partners including my friends. “What are you guys doing?” I asked Kylie and Petronella as they got up to dance with James and Daniel. But they just shrugged and went off. Amelia sat close to me, and I thought at least one person agrees with me but soon Mike came over and asked her if he could have a dance and she went all pink all over her face but in the end said yes. I was so mad with my friends; some of the kids were just watching so I just stood there with a sandwich in my hand and waited till the song was over. Later everyone resumed to their places and started chatting but I totally went mad and asked Kylie” Do you know what you’ve done now”. And she said” oh!! Come on Cindy it was fun, I liked it, and James and I got to know each other better and we’re going out to the movies next weekend”. I just stood there and said nothing, what could I do? All my friends are acting indifferent and I even wondered if they were the same people I met years ago. Then Alisha said “I’m dying to know what you’ll bought me so can you gather around to open up my presents? Everyone got into a circle and she opened up Simon’s gift, it was a notebook with stars all over it. Then Petronella gave her a pen, Kylie bought her a brooch, Amelia got her an alarm clock which was in the shape of an A. Alisha got tons of gifts like necklaces, bracelets, earrings, autograph books, photo albums, story books and she kept saying” its lovely, I love it, its beautiful, very sentimental”. Obviously mine was the last one to be opened as I was the first to arrive and I was waiting for her to look at mine and say “I love it”. I bought her a t-shirt with Barbie on it and I thought it would be perfect. But after seeing her bedroom after a long time I wasn’t so sure. She tore open the paper and said “ its nice” in a very sarcastic way but I knew now that she didn’t welcome it but I just pretended I didn’t care but deep down I was hurt and wanted to cry. We had a little more dancing and then she said in a bold voice “everybody we’re going to have a game” “A game, don’t you think that’s a bit childish” Pamela blurted out but I was happy until Alisha said “Not any game, its spin the bottle”. With that everyone got into a circle without being told except me. I just stood there, and Alisha came over to me and said “Don’t make a scene, or ruin my party, just play”. For the first time ever I just agreed and played along but I felt miserable. Each time anyone kissed anyone I murmured to myself saying” yuck”. Even Amelia and Kylie had a turn. It was my turn next and I hate boys, now I had to kiss one “go on Cindy” Alisha said with a look in her eyes that meant don’t be daft just have a go. I spun the bottle and it landed on Calvin, one of the boys in my class. Its not that I hated Calvin, I liked him but only as a friend. Actually I was the one who had to make the first move but surprisingly he did and I went mad, so mad that I stood up and said “I hate this stupid party, I can’t believe I came, I hate it, have a nice time Alisha” and I stormed out of the room expecting someone to come behind me but no one really did. I went up to the living room and saw mrs.Graham there. “What’s wrong love?” but all I could say was” would it be okay if I used your telephone?” I reckon she must have guessed that something was bothering me and I didn’t actually want to mention it so she said “Alright love, it’s over there” and pointed to my right. I replied in my politest voice saying “Thank you” and went over and dialled mum’s mobile number and asked her if she could pick me up now? She said she’ll be there in another 15 minutes so I sat down on the couch and watched the hands of the clock turn slowly. 15 minutes seemed like forever. Mum arrived and I thanked mrs.Graham and got into the car. The first question was “How was the party, Cindy”. “Good” I replied. “Is there something that you would like to tell me” she asked. At that moment I felt my face turning red and hot tears swell up and before I knew it those tears came trickling down my face. I couldn’t stop crying and I knew mum was getting worried so as soon as I went home I asked her if I can be excused from dinner and I went straight to my room, got into my pj’s ready to go to bed when mum knocked on my bedroom door. Mum always comes to speak to me when she knows I’m worried and sometimes it helps but right now I really didn’t think it would. “Come in” I answered. She came right in and said “Cindy, are you alright? Your eyes are puffed up.” “I’m fine mum” “You know sweetie, if you don’t want to talk that’s alright” At that moment I felt that I could speak to mum and I told her all that had happened. Mum always understands how I feel and gives me good advice. She listened without interrupting me and at last she spoke saying” I know that this is a very hard time for you Cindy but this is a time when things change. May-be your friends are just growing up and realising things before you, that doesn’t mean anything’s wrong with you but eventually you will be just like them soon” “I don’t want things to change, I still want to play with dolls and teddy bears, I don’t want to talk about boys and make up, and it feels as if I’m loosing my friends” “I know Cindy, but trust me, it will be different soon.” “Do you reckon what I done was wrong” I asked “Well yes, I guess, but if you call Alisha tomorrow and explain everything to her, she may understand it” “I guess so too, I feel guilty now, but I feel much better after having this little chat with you, thanks mum” She came over and gave me a hug. I really felt better and I went to bed. The next morning I got up, although I felt guilty and I wanted to speak to Alisha I didn’t feel like I wanted but I knew I had to. I had a wash and went downstairs with the intention to call Alisha but a surprise awaited me there. “Surprise” And I really felt relieved for some reason to see my friends. Mum also was there and I certainly didn’t want to apologise in front of mum so I said “can we go up to our room”. “Wait a sec” Kylie replied and lifted up a big brown paper bag. When we went upstairs, everyone was silent, then I broke the silence by saying “Alisha, I’m sorry I spoilt your bir- thday party, I was….” But before I could finish Kylie opened the brown paper back and brought out chips and a few sandwiches “these are the remains from yesterday, I thought maybe we could have a little chat. “Where’s petronella?” I asked “She has a dentist’s appointment” Alisha answered. For the first time today Amelia said” I’m sorry Cindy, we should have been with you, instead we went off dancing and playing. “ Look you guys, I know that I still act like a little kid but that doesn’t mean you have to be like me, I know someday soon I’ll be like you’ll and I’m waiting for that day but I still want to be a little girl and I want us to remain friends forever” I replied. The room went silent again and then Alisha came over and put her arm around me and said “ Cindy its alright even though we realise certain things before you we’ll still be your friends” . “Really” “Yeah of course”. We started talking about what programs would be on TV and Kylie all of a sudden started grinning which brought suspicion upon all of us. “Spit it out Kylie” I said “Cindy, I’m not sure if you’re going to like this but…” “What, hurry up” “Yesterday when you spun the bottle, you were supposed to go forward to kiss Calvin but he came forward instead.” “So” I asked “Later he told me that he wants to go out with you because he liked you” I started to blush and I felt like I was on the top of the world. “Yes” Alisha then said “so we answered for you, saying yes” “I’m going out with Ian on Saturday and so are Kylie and James and Petronella and Daniel and Amelia and Mike. So we decided that we like to all go out together”. “It will be fun Cindy” Amelia said Again I felt happy and I said “I have to ask mum, just a sec”. I darted down and saw mum sewing.”Mum will it be okay if I go out with my friends and another friend this weekend to the movies?” “Who’s this other friend?” “Calvin, he asked me out so I want to go out”? “Sweetie, are you doing this just so you can keep your friends?” “No mum, I feel different now, can I go?” “If you feel comfy with it”. I was so happy and Alisha couldn’t believe her eyes. We started talking about what we would wear and Alisha persuaded me that she’d do my makeup. Saturday finally came and mum picked out a blue top with silver hearts all over it. It looked really pretty. Mum said she’d drop me off. When I saw my friends there I was relieved. I said bye to mum and gave her a quick kiss and went. I saw everyone there and then I saw Calvin, my heart skipped a beat. He looked gorgeous in his jeans and t-shirt. He held a red rose in his hand and kept smiling at me. “This is for you” he said, handing me the rose “and you look pretty” “Thank you and I like your pair of jeans” I replied. Immediately Alisha whispered in my ear “yuck!! Look who’s going out with a boy and telling him he looks good too”. “Stop it Alisha” I replied but I could feel myself blushing. “Let’s get going, the movie’s starting in about 5 minutes and I’ve bought the tickets” Alisha said. “Where are Petronella and Daniel?” I asked “They are in already”. Amelia replied. We went in and found our seats easily, off course I was seated next o Calvin. The lights went out and the movie started but instead of watching Calvin and I were chatting, till someone from behind shouted” will you two down there shut up”. So I suggested that we go and have something to eat. “Alisha, we’re going out down to the café, meet us up there” and we went up to the café. On the way Calvin and I were speaking about lots of stuff and then in the course of conversation he asked” What happened yesterday? Was it because you have never kissed anyone before or anything else?” “Yes I’ve never kissed anyone before and I guess I was not ready”. I didn’t want to tell him the actual reason, what if he thought if I was weird or anything?”. “Can I tell you something” he said “What’s that, Calvin?” “I really like you, Cindy and its okay if you haven’t had your first kiss because I’ve never had one too”. I was surprised but I just said as calm as I could “Calvin, you seem like a pretty cool guy and I like you too”. He smiled and before I could say anything else he leant over and kissed me. I felt as if I could scream. I just smiled and suddenly we saw everyone else come into the café. “Is the movie over already, Petronella?” I asked “No but we’re bored”. The evening went of perfectly; mum said she’d pick me up at 8.00. The others had their parents to pick them up too and one by one everyone else left except Calvin and myself. He said he’ll wait till my mum comes. Mum finally arrived and before I could go he said “Cindy, I had fun, and can we go out some other time?” “I had fun too and I hope we go out again, bye”. I quickly gave him a kiss on the cheek and ran to the car. As soon I was strapped mum asked me “how was your evening”? “Excellent mum, I loved it”. “That’s good, sweetheart, was that Calvin standing there with you?” “Yeah mum, he said he’ll wait with me till you come” “That’s nice of him, ask him to come home sometime and have dinner”. Mum kept on talking but I was wondering why I had spoken about boys so badly, some of them are really nice. The next day Alisha, Kylie, Petronella and Amelia came over to my place and we just kept chatting about yesterday. “you guys I’m sorry, I didn’t understand that it can be fun to hang around boys, but I’m happy cos I had a nice time yesterday, my first date, my first kiss and ………”. “Wait a minute, you didn’t tell us anything about your first kiss” Petronella said “Didn’t I, I thought I did” I replied as casually as I could but I couldn’t help blushing. They wanted to know exactly every little detail so I told them and when we were finished, Alisha said” I told you, you will be like us soon and soon has come” “I know I said, and it feels great to have such good friends like you’ll to chat to. Thanks “ Kylie said “friends forever” Yeah we all replied “friends forever”. So it was fun and I wouldn’t change my friends a bit cos I really liked them. It was great to be friends again and to tell you the truth it does feel great to hang around boys especially boys like Calvin. THE END Its Alisha’s 11 th birthday and our five friends are having a disagreement, while Cindy thinks boys are yuck, the others seem to say its fun to hang around boys. Things are changing rapidly for the five of them. What will happen next?

HIGH SCHOOL AT LAST “That’s it I had it young lady, no more talking about this” dad said almost shouting. “But dad…” I said “That’s not fair”. “Jessica, could you pass me the peanut butter” dad spoke completely ignoring my statement. With that I had to rest my case but I still think that it’s unfair. There is the mega problem that has just exploded in my house partly because of me, well the whole problem is because of me (I can’t help it). I guess you’re still confused with all this stuff. Let me explain this more clearly. I’m Kylie Rodriguez and I live in Canley Heights Australia . It’s a wonderful place in fact it seems like the best place on earth and I go to Canley Heights Primary School which is the best school on earth but it won’t be too long before I have to leave this amazing school. It’s like this we (my friends and I) went to this school since Kindergarten and we love it but they get to go to Canley Heights High School (all four of them) and I have to go to Canterbury High School which is about an hour’s drive from here. And I don’t want to go. My friends are Amelia, Alisha, Petronella and Cindy along with my boyfriend James. We are all 13 (at least most of us). Cindy is best friend and has been my best friend since forever and she’s really the best, best friend any one can have, she has black hair with brown complexion and jet black hair, she’s a bit chubby and tall. She has no dad or brothers or sisters and lives with her mum. Excepting the fact that that she gets really angry very easily she’s pretty cool. Then my next friend is Alisha she used to get really snobbish at first but I think Petronella rubbed her edges of her and now she’s just okay. She loves to sing and dance and when she grows up she wants to become a model, gosh she will be perfect for that job because she’s really skinny and a very fair complexion. Alisha has an elder sister and an elder brother. Petronella has a brother; well he’s not her real brother but her step brother-Mark. She used to live with her mum alone but then her mum started dating and now that guy (Nathan) has moved in with them and they are deciding their wedding which will be in a couple of weeks. They first decided a date and then they postponed the date. Petronella has lime complexion with brownish- blackish hair and is very studious and she loves reading just like me. The next friend of mine is Amelia, who’s the quietest person in our group. She has a step brother and she lives with her adopted parents. Amelia also has lime complexion and light brown hair. She loves reading but she doesn’t read stuff like me she reads books on animals. When she grows up she wants to become a Vet (a doctor for animals). “Kylie, look who’s here” Jessica called out. Well I almost forgot I have a sister and I live with both my parents. Jessica’s 9 and she goes to the same Primary school as me. We get along together most of the time except that she’s always the genius of the family and off course the baby of the family. She always gets most of the attention and I don’t. I’m usually not the jealous type except when it comes to her. “Who is it?” I shouted back. “Come down and see” she called back. She can be very tantalising at times and it annoys me. I ran down as fast as I could and there I could see my mum and dad speaking to a girl whose back was turned towards me and I couldn’t help but scream “Angela”. Angela has always been my favourite cousin and she helps me sort out my problems just by talking to me. She has black long hair and brown complexion. It had been a long time since I’ve seen her because she lives in Melbourne and she rarely visits but we have lots of fun when she comes even though she is about ten years older to me. “Kylie” she greeted me “how are you”. “I’m good” I replied and I ran over to her and hugged and kissed her. “How are you?” I asked “when did you arrive? How long are you …” I began when Jessica interrupted me “Don’t you think she needs time to relax Kylie after her long flight”. “Brat” I muttered under my breath. But just as I looked up my dad’s eyes were on me so I just smiled and spoke “Um… actually yes I think you do Angela, I’m sorry”. “That’s okay” she replied “I’m staying over for the next week or two because I’m changing jobs and I thought I’ll have a break before starting over at my new job”. “Awesome” I replied “We can have tons of fun together this time”. “Well I don’t think Angela will want to spend lots of time with you this time because Ken has come with her” mum said. “Ken!! Who’s Ken?” I asked. “Ken is my boy friend and he’s come down from Melbourne and he’s staying at one of his friends place” Angela said. “Okay” I said. I think my voice must have sounded exactly how I felt-disappointed because immediately Angela said in a rather kind voice “We can still do some of the stuff together, but not as much as we used to”. “Great” I replied trying to sound cheerful and trying to smile but I knew that Angela would’ve known that I was still a bit disappointed. Everything settled down and the evening came, James my boy friend called up. We’ve been going out for eight months. “Kylie” he asked. “James” I replied “How are you?” he asked. “I’m good thank you, how are you?” “Oh I’m okay, listen I was wondering if you want to go out for a drink of coke or something at McDonald’s” he asked. “Sure” I replied “Meet you at the end of the street in ten minutes”. “See you then” he said and hung up. I took out my jumper because it was a bit windy and I didn’t want to catch a cold. It was about five in the evening and it was already turning a bit dark. “Mum, dad” I called out “I’m going down to McDonald’s with James now”. “What time will you return?” I could hear mum ask.. “In an hour or so” I replied. Immediately Jessica came down to me and asked “Can you bring me a cheese burger and some chips?” “Jessica” I replied “I’m going out with a boy and he’s paying; what do you want me to ask? ‘Can you buy my little sister a burger?’ I don’t think so”. “Here’s the money Kylie” Angela said appearing on the scene “You needn’t ask him for the money, you can get a burger for your sister yourself”. “But…” I tried to speak but I couldn’t think of anything to say. “But what? She asked. “Okay” I replied and taking the money from her “Spoilt brat” I muttered under my breath. “I heard that” Jessica said “Angela, did you hear that?” “Yes, I did” Angela replied “And I’m a bit worried about Kylie’s behaviour”. “My behaviour” I asked “I don’t think there’s anything wrong with my behaviour or even if there is, it wouldn’t be happening if this little brat wants everything she sees”. “Kylie stop that nonsense” Angela said in a tone that really she meant what she said “She’s your sister and what’s wrong with her asking for something?” “Everything” I replied “I can’t go out with some of my friends and there she is asking for something or worrying to come”. “Your so annoying Jess” I said with a change in my tonality. “Get going will you” Angela said looking at me and then turning to Jessica she said “Jess, let’s play monopoly now, can we?” “She’s such a looser” I mutter to myself. “Stop that now, Kylie, will you?” Angela said. I just walked out of the house and kept thinking all the way how Angela spoke to me and I realised that I felt really hurt and I started crying but as I came close to McDonald’s I wiped my tears away and when I saw James I tried my best to smile but he knew at once that something was wrong and gave me a hug as soon as I came. I went closer to him then he kissed me. “What’s wrong?” he asked. “Nothing” I replied “nothing at all”. “Really?” he asked “Then why is your face tearstained and your eyes all red”. “I just had a little fight” I replied trying not to start crying. “With whom?” he asked. “Can we not talk about this?” I asked. “Fine” he replied “That’s okay”. Just then I noticed how hurt he felt and I didn’t want to fight with every one today. “Jamie, I’m sorry” I started “I didn’t mean to hurt you or anything and actually I do need someone to talk to right now”. “That’s okay Kylie” he replied “You can talk to me anytime you want okay” and taking my hand we went inside. we got our stuff and we sat down. “What’s wrong” he started. “My cousin Angela has come down from Melbourne and she has a boy friend” I said. “What’s wrong with that?” James asked. “Nothing’s wrong with that but now we had a fight and guess whose side she took” I asked. “Jess’s” he asked. “Yes, can’t believe she above all people, we used to be best friends and now it seems so different” I said trying to eat the burger that I had in my hand. “Why, what did you do?” James asked as he was sipping on his coke. “It’s a silly thing, um… Jess wanted me to get her a burger and I said that I was going out and I can’t but as soon as I said I can’t Angela came on the scene and handing over the money to me she said that I had to and then when I called Jess a brat she … she..” I couldn’t say anything more because I was choked. Slowly James took my hand and spoke slowly “Oh!! Don’t worry Kylie, it’s such a small thing Angela will probably forget about it by the time your home. “She probably will” I said but I wished I could really believe that. We finished our snack and I got Jessica a burger with some French fries and I started on my way home. When I arrived Jessica came running to me “So you did get it, thanks” she said and snatched the stuff out of my hand. “How was your date?” Angela asked as she came into the living room. “Not too bad” I replied “At least I had some peace of mind which I don’t seem to be getting here”. “You know, even I get peace of mind when I’m out with Ken, it feels great doesn’t it?” she asked as if nothing had happened. But I was hurt, terribly hurt and I wasn’t just going to let this drift by. “Yeah, whatever” I replied and started walking out of the living room. “What’s her problem?” I heard Jessica’s voice. “Probably a bad date” Angela replied and both of them giggled. I felt my cheeks go red and I started crying. I can’t believe Angela’s changed so much. This Ken guy must have done something to her because this is not the Angela I know. That night after dinner I went up to my room and took out a magazine to read, it was a Girlfriend magazine. As I was reading someone knocked on my door “Who is it?” I asked. “Kylie, it’s me Angela”. “Come in” I replied. Angela came into the room and plonked herself on my bed “So” she began “Was there any problem?” “Problem?” I asked feeling a bit edgy. “Yes” she said “With your date with James”. “One, it was not a date, two, there was no problem, the only problem I have is having a younger sister” I replied. “Kylie, c’mon your sister is not all that bad, you should be proud of her she’s such a talented girl, did she tell you about that math...” Angela started. That day went off perfectly, I apologised to my pals and they gave me the confidence that they’ll always be there for me and I’m glad. The only thing left for me to do was make more friends. The sleep over went off brilliantly too. It was Monday morning and I got dressed for school and I caught the bus. We travelled for a while and then she asked me “Who do you hang around with at school?” “Um…” I began wondering what reply to give her, should I tell her that I have not yet made friends, how can I tell her the truth then after a few seconds I replied “No one really, I have no friends at school because I’m new”. “Oh” she said with a funny look in her eyes, she hesitated to say something then she finally spoke clearly “You can hang around with my friends and myself at school”. School went on as usual and I met all the other girls, there was Kimberly who seemed to be the boss of the group and there was Helen, Amanda, Lena and there were a few guys around, one of them looked so elegant and smart and so charming but very quickly I corrected myself and told my self that James was there. At school, I made lots of other friends and it was just perfect. “Hello you” I heard a familiar voice when I picked up the phone. I had a quick shower, wrote a not to mum MUM, JUST GOING OUT TO JAMES’S, WILL BE BACK IN AN HOUR OR SO KYLIE. It really seemed like he was having a tough time with his little sister, he was carrying her and he looked completely tired. “Looks like your having a really tough time now” I said. “Yeah” he replied, just then Emily started crying. “May I?” I asked James stretching out my hands out to carry Emily. “With Pleasure” he said. I actually got on very well with Emily, but I didn’t t do anything extraordinary, I just did normal stuff (Baby stuff). After a while Emily was napping and James and I were having a banana split that was readymade. “Kylie” James began and he had a serious expression on his face “You know… how you and I are… going out and stuff, I think…we have to, you know…” I could see that he was trying hard to bring out the right words. “Break up?” I helped him out. “Yeah” he said “it’s so hard like not to notice other girls at school” he said. I tried to manufacture a smile but I guess I didn’t succeed. “Kylie, you’re a really good friend and you are really the best girlfriend ever, but that’s why I don’t want to hurt your feelings” James said. “I know” I said “I face the same problem when I’m at school”. “Really”? “Yeah” I replied “But we still can be good friends, can’t we?” “Of course” he said “So?” “So that’s it then” I replied “My first break up with my first boyfriend”. After that I felt Goosebumps on my skin and my eyes become heavy with tears and before I could stop myself I started crying and the best thing was I didn’t know why. “I’m sorry Kylie, I didn’t mean to hurt you” James said. “Its okay” I replied wiping my eyes and trying to stop myself from crying “I didn’t think I’ll take it so badly”. He leaned over and gave me a hug, I looked up at him and he managed a small smile “I better get going” I said “It’s getting late”. “Okay” he said “I’m sorry about that…. Its just that I don’t want to cause you to get hurt”. “I understand” I replied “sorry if I made such a great deal out of it”. “Thanks for helping me out with Emily” James said. “That’s okay”. I put on my jumper and went out doors. It was a bit chill out side or may be it was only me feeling chill. “Kylie” I heard a voice, I turned around it was James “Yeah” I said. “Friends Forever?” he asked. “No” I replied “Friends now and forever”. He smiled and I smiled back. I went back to my house and into my bed room. I took up a book and started reading. Someone knocked on my door. “Come in” “Hai Kylie” Jessica said coming in. “Hi, how was school?” I asked. “Good and you? She asked. “Excellent” I replied. “Really?” she asked “Because you look really sad”. “Do I?” I asked “There’s nothing really wrong”. “If you don’t want to tell me that’s fine, Kylie” She said. “Okay I’ll tell you after all you’re my sister” I said “I just broke up with James”. “Aw! I’m sorry” Jessica said “How come?” “It’s because now that we’re in high school things become so different, there are plenty of other girls and boys that we’d prefer someone else” I said. “But aren’t you sad?” Jessica asked. “A bit, yes” I replied “but every thing happens for a reason”. “Kylie?” Jessica asked “You know the time we spent together?” “Yeah” “I had the best time of my life” she said . “I’m glad to hear that Jess” I said “That’s really good, and we can do more stuff together later “. She came over and gave me a hug, I hardly ever hug my sister and this was something unusual. Jessica probably did have the best time of her life. “Kylie, there’s a phone call for you” I could hear mum call. “Commin” I shouted back. I ran down as fast as I could. “Hey Kylie” I immediately recognised that voice; it was Angela’s “Angela!!” I said. “Hey Kylie, I got your e-mail just today” Angela said “Look I’m sorry if your school isn’t the best now”. “No Angela” I said “It’s just perfect now, I’ve made a few friends and it’s really great I love it”. “Oh, that’s great then” Angela said “I’m glad to hear that and I hope you make more friends”. “Angela, how’s Ken?” “He’s alright, how’s James?” “James and I um… are not going out anymore, we broke up” I said. “I’m sorry” Angela said. “Well, don’t be” I said. “Well aren’t you feeling sad?” Angela asked. “At first I was, but he finds it difficult not to notice other girls and I guess that’s a good enough reason, so that means we don’t trust each other so much and trust is one of the basic necessities in a relationship and we don’t have it so… well I guess that’s it” I said and then took a breath after speaking such a lot. “You speak as if you’re a grown up Kylie” Angela said and she laughed. I didn’t know whether to laugh or not so I just said okay. I chatted to her for a while more and then I went up to bed. The End High School is something that the girls always looked forward to but it isn’t what Kylie actually wanted. It’s time to move on and get into high school and Kylie’s parents want her to go to a different school from her friends. She absolutely hates the very thought of it. She tries to explain to her parents that she cannot leave her friends or her boyfriend-James. She tries to explain things to her cousin-Angela but right now she feels that everyone is against her and everyone hates her but above all she gets jealous of Jessica- her sister. Once there was a little girl named Claire, she had everything she wanted in life, good home, good friends, and good education. But she always seemed to be discontented with herself. She was a girl of 13 with straight jet black hair, black eyes, lovely features but she always seemed to be complaining about her looks. Her parents and elders kept telling her that she looked fine but she never seemed happy like for instance just because she saw someone on TV with blonde hair, she wanted blonde hair. One day as she was passing by a shop on her way home, from school, she was having a conversation with her friend Elizabeth " How I wish I had blue eyes instead of black eyes, at least then I would be beautiful” just then a busker (a person who entertains people on the street) who was playing a violin spoke out in a firm yet kind voice " At least you have eyes to see the world, never mind the colour ". When she turned towards this man she saw he was blind. Till today she is discontented with herself but at least now she tries to be contented with herself and every time she thinks of putting herself down or criticizing her self a picture of that poor man flashes in front of her.
